ticket.title: [Tests] Deprecation in all tests, StatementInvalid in ActiveRecord
ticket.original-body:
I pulled master just now, ran 'gem bundle' in all folders containing a Gemfile, and now I'm getting the following issues:
* Deprecation warnings in all tests * Segfault in ActionPack * StatementInvalid from Mysql ActiveRecord * IOError in SQLite and PostgreSQL ActiveRecord * "instance variable @transaction_joinable not initialized" in ActiveModel * test_rails_is_frozen test failure in Railties
It would seem things are not in a well state :-(

ticket.latest-body:
I pulled master just now, ran 'gem bundle' in all folders containing a Gemfile, and now I'm getting the following issues:
* Deprecation warnings in all tests * Segfault in ActionPack * StatementInvalid from Mysql ActiveRecord * IOError in SQLite and PostgreSQL ActiveRecord * "instance variable @transaction_joinable not initialized" in ActiveModel * test_rails_is_frozen test failure in Railties
It would seem things are not in a well state :-(

ticket.original-body-html:
I pulled master just now, ran 'gem bundle' in all folders containing a Gemfile, and now I'm getting the following issues:

  • Deprecation warnings in all tests
  • Segfault in ActionPack
  • StatementInvalid from Mysql ActiveRecord
  • IOError in SQLite and PostgreSQL ActiveRecord
  • "instance variable @transaction_joinable not initialized" in ActiveModel
  • test_rails_is_frozen test failure in Railties

It would seem things are not in a well state :-(

version.body:
I pulled master just now, ran 'gem bundle' in all folders containing a Gemfile, and now I'm getting the following when running tests.
It would seem things are not in a well state :-(
Edit 1: I'm going to keep checking this daily. Please check back. Be assured I am running 'gem bundle' in each directory before the tests.
Edit 2: Nice. With only one single gem bundle to run, down to one last error in ActiveRecord. No one on IRC knows how to fix this one :-( Still getting a bunch of deprecation warnings too.

version.body-html:
I pulled master just now, ran 'gem bundle' in all folders containing a Gemfile, and now I'm getting the following when running tests.

It would seem things are not in a well state :-(

Edit 1: I'm going to keep checking this daily. Please check back. Be assured I am running 'gem bundle' in each directory before the tests.

Edit 2: Nice. With only one single gem bundle to run, down to one last error in ActiveRecord. No one on IRC knows how to fix this one :-( Still getting a bunch of deprecation warnings too.

version.body:
% mysql --version mysql Ver 14.14 Distrib 5.1.39, for apple-darwin9.5.0 (i386) using readline 5.1
So only one version behind what you upgraded to. I'm using the Apple binary from the MySQL website.
